page.title: 12BASILDON NE: NORTHLANDS PARK
page.content: The area has been developed as a public park around connected large and small man-made lakes, there for land drainage purposes. The local council maintain and continually improve the area. Several access points lead from neighbouring estates. Small hills provide views of surrounding areas. Its many facilities include a trimtrack for jogging, children's play equipment, picnic areas, crazy golf and 'beach' areas. Small areas have been left in their natural state to encourage wild life. Ducks have raised their young among the reeds around the lakes. Various trees have been planted for landscaping purposes. Grassy areas are cut regularly. Life belts and signs prohibiting boating and swimming are in prominent view for the personal safety of park patrons.
